item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenID Connect specifications published as ISO standards (47 points | 6 comments)
2. JVM Anatomy Quarks (54 points | 12 comments)
3. Section 230 Immunizes OnlyFans for User-Uploaded Video–DOE vs. Fenix (24 points | 5 comments)

5. Typesetting Engines: A Programmer's Perspective (37 points | 5 comments)

7. Thoughts on the Resiliency of Web Projects (22 points | 2 comments)

10. Procrastination and the fear of not being good enough (3 points | discuss)
11. Rust Trademark Policy Updates (6 points | discuss)

13. Mind-Bending Soviet Era Oil Rig City on the Caspian Sea (159 points | 55 comments)
14. Functional architecture of cerebral cortex during naturalistic movie watching (10 points | 1 comment)
15. 19th Century Map Shows a Fictional Country Created by a Con Man (49 points | 13 comments)
16. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (598 points | 183 comments)

19. Ratting on wildlife crime: training rats to detect illegally trafficked wildlife (14 points | discuss)

22. AI-Time Travel-Street View (20 points | 14 comments)
23. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (257 points | 97 comments)
24. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (116 points | 29 comments)
25. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (172 points | 24 comments)
26. Salary expectations questions – How should you answer them? (20 points | 18 comments)
27. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (155 points | 83 comments)
28. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (390 points | 81 comments)
29. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (44 points | 3 comments)
30. When machine learning tells the wrong story (245 points | 25 comments)
